Text.Value: Is that so? Then we'd best hope you don't make any further miscalculations. We both know what happened the last time you took something you thought you deserved.
I think she misses me.
I think I felt Mystra's presence...
Well, she has a funny way of showing it, doesn't she, considering what she's asked of you?
I promise - these shadow powers will help us, even if they are... impure.
A private matter. Nothing to concern yourself with.
You sound just like Mystra.
You did what? What the devil has gotten into you?
Oh, but I do concern myself, Mr Dekarios. Even when you're being as annoying as you are now.
I indulged in some dark magic to create a Shadow Lantern.
I was curled up here quite comfortably when I was suddenly overcome with uneasiness. A tressym's intuition is rarely wrong. What's happened?
I trust you'll treat whatever she had to say with the required lashings of salt. Better to keep your own wisdom than hers, Mr Dekarios. Or better yet, keep mine.
I'll leave you to your secrets, Mr Dekarios, but allow me to remind you of a simple fact. We rarely hide that which we know is right.
I passed up an opportunity to serve Mystra's will. To give her a sign I've changed.
I indulged in some dark magic to create a Shadow Lantern.
You may as well leave your life lessons in a bucket, for all the good they do you.
The lantern will be useful to us. And I'll be sure to wield it carefully.
Nothing you need to be concerned about.
I'll believe it when I see it, and not a moment before.
I drew power from a source of shadow magic. A corpse, to be specific.
Good. Then she's speaking sense, at last.
Be very careful, Mr Dekarios. You're on a terrifying road. One misstep could be your last. And then I'd be - oh, terribly cranky.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's making light of how sad she'd be if Gale died.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Gale has never chosen to disobey Mystra, but he's never chosen to act in favour of Mystra, either.

Text.Value: I have a strategy in mind. One that involves not willingly provoking Mystra's anger.
You did? Well that is a turn-up for the books. And what led her to grace you with her presence?

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bit of suspicion. Tara is not so sure about Mystra lately.

Text.Value: I know exactly what I'm doing. Taking the power I deserve to wield.
Mr Dekarios! There you are!
You've a keen eye, Tara. I drew power from a source of shadow magic.
Just because Mystra demands my life, doesn't mean I do her dirty work. I make my own choices.

Synopsis: Gale absorbed dangerous shadow magic from a morally dubious source, in defiance of Mystra's command that he dispel it. Tara picks up on this, leading to a short conversation where he can tell her about it or not.
